text: 第2第3足の子か / これ以上増えないことを望むな
translation: The second and third children, huh. / I hope no more appear.
grammar: これ以上 + negative verb expresses 'no more than this' or 'not any further'

text: 昨日キール議長から計画遅延の文句が来たぞ / 俺のとこに直接 / 相当イラついてたな
translation: Yesterday Chairman Keel sent a complaint about the plan delays. / Directly to me. / He was pretty irritated.
grammar: ぞ is a masculine sentence-ending particle adding emphasis or assertion

text: しまいにはお前の解任もほのめかしていたぞ / アダムは順調だ / エヴァ計画もダミープラグに着手している / ゼーレの老人は / 何が不満なんだ
translation: In the end, he even hinted at your dismissal. / Adam is progressing well. / The Eva project has also begun work on the dummy plug. / What are those SEELE elders dissatisfied with?
grammar: しまいには means 'in the end' or 'finally' often with negative connotation

text: 肝心の人類補完計画が遅れてる
translation: The crucial Human Instrumentality Project is behind schedule.

vocabulary.meaning: to be late, to fall behind

grammar: 肝心の + noun emphasizes that something is 'the crucial/essential' thing

text: 全ての計画はリンクしている / 問題はない / レイもか?
translation: All the plans are linked. / There's no problem. / Even Rei?
grammar: も + か at the end expresses surprise or seeks confirmation about inclusion

text: まあいい
translation: Well, fine.
grammar: まあいい is a set phrase meaning 'whatever' or 'fine, let it go'

text: ところであの男はどうする? / 好きにさせておくさ マルドゥック機関と同じだ / もうしばらくは役に立ってもらうか
translation: By the way, what do we do about that man? / Let him do as he likes. Same as the Marduk Institute. / We'll have him be useful for a while longer.
grammar: させておく (causative + ておく) means to let someone do something and leave it that way

text: 16年前 ここで何が始まったんだ
translation: 16 years ago... what started here?
grammar: んだ (explanatory の + だ) seeks explanation or expresses seeking understanding

text: 私だ
translation: It's me.
grammar: Simple copula statement used when answering a phone or door

text: ああ 何だか / シャノンバイオー 外資系のケミカル会社
translation: Oh, what is it? / Shannon Bio - a foreign-owned chemical company.
grammar: 外資系 is a compound noun describing companies with foreign capital investment

text: 9年前からここにあるが 9年前からこの姿のままだ
translation: It's been here since 9 years ago, but it's remained in this state since 9 years ago.
grammar: から...まま indicates something has remained unchanged since a point in time

text: マルドゥック機関とつながる 108の企業のうち 106がダミーだったよ
translation: Of the 108 companies connected to the Marduk Institute, 106 were dummies.
grammar: のうち means 'among' or 'out of' when discussing parts of a whole

text: ここが107個目というわけだ / この会社の等規模だ / 取締役の乱を見ろったろ
translation: So this is the 107th one. / This is the scale of this company. / You saw the board of directors list, right?
grammar: というわけだ expresses a logical conclusion - 'so that means' or 'in other words'

text: もう知っていたか / 知ってる名前ばかりだしな
translation: You already knew? / They're all names I recognize.
grammar: ばかり emphasizes exclusivity - 'nothing but' or 'only'

text: マルドゥック機関エヴァンゲリオン操縦者選出のために設けられた人類補完委員会直属の指紋機関組織の実態はいまだ不透明
translation: The Marduk Institute - established for selecting Evangelion pilots, directly under the Human Instrumentality Committee. The true nature of this organization remains unclear.
grammar: ために indicates purpose - 'for the purpose of'

text: 貴様の仕事はネルフの内定だマルドゥックに顔を出すのはまずいぞま
translation: Your job is NERV's internal affairs. Showing up at Marduk is risky.

vocabulary.meaning: to show one's face, to appear

grammar: 顔を出す is an idiom meaning to make an appearance or show up somewhere

text: 何事もね自分の目で確かめないと気が済まないたちだからはい
translation: I'm the type who can't rest until I see everything with my own eyes.

vocabulary.meaning: to be satisfied, to feel at ease

grammar: 気が済まない expresses being unable to feel satisfied until something is done

text: カジですただいま外出していますご用の方はお名前とメッセージをどうぞ
translation: This is Kaji. I'm currently out. If you need something, please leave your name and message.
grammar: ご用の方 is a polite way to say 'those who have business/need something'

text: ああああああああああああああああああああ
translation: Aaaaaaah!
grammar: Extended vocalization expressing strong emotion

text: なんちゃって どうしたの
translation: Just kidding! What's up?
grammar: なんちゃって is casual slang meaning 'just kidding' or 'gotcha'

text: 明日の日曜日さ カジさんにどっかつれてってもらおうかなと思って電話したんだけども
translation: It's Sunday tomorrow, so I called thinking I'd get Kaji to take me somewhere, but...
grammar: てもらおうかな expresses thinking about having someone do something for you

text: ずっといないの ここんとこいつかけてもルスってことは明日ヒマなのね / 残念ながらそういうことじゃあさ ちょっと頼みがあるんだけど
translation: He's never there. Every time I call lately it's his answering machine... so that means you're free tomorrow? / Unfortunately, that's the case. Hey, I have a favor to ask.
grammar: ってことは indicates drawing a conclusion - 'that means' or 'so then'

text: ほっ実はさ
translation: Actually...
grammar: 実は is used to introduce something the speaker is about to confess or reveal

text: a デートー / 小玉お姉ちゃんの友達なんだけどどうしても紹介してくれって頼まれちゃってさ お願い
translation: A date?! / It's my friend's older sister's friend, and they kept asking me to introduce you. Please!
grammar: てくれって頼まれる is passive of request - 'was asked to do X for someone'

text: ています
translation: (fragment - unclear context)
grammar: Incomplete segment, likely part of ています (continuous form)

text: きっ
translation: (sound effect / incomplete)
grammar: Fragment or sound effect

text: きっ
translation: (sound effect / incomplete)
grammar: Fragment or sound effect

text: バッカだし / オレンジのは? / 最近着てないじゃない / あれね
translation: That's stupid. / What about the orange one? / You haven't been wearing it lately, have you? / Oh, that one...
grammar: じゃない at sentence end is a colloquial negative question seeking confirmation, similar to 'right?' or 'isn't it?'

text: あれはちょっちわけありで / きついの? / そうよ
translation: That one has a bit of a story behind it... / Is it too tight? / Yeah.

vocabulary.meaning: having a reason/story behind it, complicated circumstances
a little bit (casual form of ちょっと)

grammar: わけありで uses わけ (reason) + あり (exists) to mean 'there's a reason/circumstance' - a common euphemism.

text: 帰りに慎重するか / うーん / 出費がかさむな
translation: Should we buy new clothes on the way back? / Hmm... / The expenses are piling up.
grammar: するか is a casual volitional question form meaning 'shall we?' or 'should I?'

text: こう立て続けだと / ご主義もバカにならないしね / けっ / みそじ前だからって / どいつもこいつも焦りやがって / お互い最後の一人には / なりたくないわね
translation: With events happening one after another like this... / The gift money really adds up. / Tch! / Just because they're almost thirty... / Everyone's rushing to get married. / Neither of us wants to be the last single one, right?

vocabulary.meaning: to be in a hurry, to rush

grammar: やがって is a vulgar suffix expressing irritation or contempt about someone's actions.

text: 3人とも上がっていいわよ / お疲れ様 / ああああ / テストばっかでつまんない
translation: All three of you can come up now. / Good work today. / Ahh... / Nothing but tests, it's so boring.

vocabulary.meaning: thank you for your hard work
nothing but, only (casual form of ばかり)
boring (casual form of つまらない)

grammar: ていい is a permission form meaning 'it's okay to' or 'you may.'

text: そういえば / 今日はまた一段と暗いわね / シンジ君 / 明日だからね / そうね / 明日ね / 明日
translation: Come to think of it... / You seem even more gloomy today. / Shinji-kun. / It's because of tomorrow. / Right... / Tomorrow. / Tomorrow...

vocabulary.meaning: come to think of it, speaking of which

grammar: 一段と is an intensifier meaning 'even more' or 'a step further,' emphasizing a comparative degree.

text: 父さんに会わなきゃならないんだ
translation: I have to meet with my father.
grammar: なきゃならない is a colloquial contraction of なければならない, expressing obligation ('must' or 'have to').

text: 何話せばいいと思う / どうして私にそんなこと聞くの
translation: What do you think I should talk about? / Why are you asking me something like that?
grammar: ばいい expresses 'should' or 'would be good to,' used for advice or wondering what to do.

text: いつかアナミが父さんと楽しそうに話してるのを見たから
translation: Because I once saw you talking happily with my father.
grammar: そうに attached to adjective stems expresses appearance: 'looking like' or 'seeming to be.'

text: ねえ父さんってどんな人
translation: Hey, what kind of person is my father?
grammar: って is a casual quotation particle, here used to mark the topic like は but more colloquially.

text: わからない
translation: I don't know.
grammar: Plain negative form of わかる, commonly used to express not knowing or not understanding.

text: そう / それが聞きたくて昼間から私の方を見てたの
translation: I see. / So that's what you wanted to ask, and that's why you've been looking at me since this afternoon?
grammar: たくて is the te-form of たい (want to), connecting the desire to the following action as a reason.

text: あれってなんかお母さんって感じがした / お / 母さん
translation: That somehow felt like... a mother. / A... mother?
grammar: って感じがする means 'it feels like' or 'gives the impression of,' expressing a subjective feeling.

text: なんか / お母さんの絞り方って感じがする
translation: Somehow... / It feels like the way a mother would wring things out.
grammar: Verb stem + 方 creates a noun meaning 'way of doing' something.

text: 案外綾波って主婦とかが似合ってたりしたい
translation: Surprisingly, being a housewife might actually suit you, Ayanami.

vocabulary.meaning: to suit, to look good on

grammar: たりする softens a statement, suggesting possibility or that something might be the case.

text: 何を / 言 / うなよ
translation: What are you... saying? Don't say that.
grammar: なよ is a casual negative imperative, meaning 'don't do' - softer than な alone.

text: ただいまー / おかえり / よ明日デートなんじゃなかったの コピケート
translation: I'm home! / Welcome back. / Hey, wasn't your date supposed to be tomorrow? A blind date.
grammar: んじゃなかった is a casual past negative question form expressing surprise that something wasn't as expected.

text: あそうだねあれかしてよラベンダーの香水 ダメ
translation: Oh right, about that - can you lend me that lavender perfume? / No way.
grammar: てよ is a casual request form, often used by women, meaning 'please do' something.

text: チェケチ子供のするものじゃないわ シンジ君は部屋 / お守りっぱなしよ父親に会うのが嫌みたい 嫌なら嫌って言えばいいのに日本人ってのはね
translation: Hmph, perfume isn't something for children. Shinji-kun has been shut up in his room the whole time. He seems to hate meeting his father. If he hates it, he should just say so. That's the thing about Japanese people...
grammar: っぱなし indicates leaving something in a continuous state, here 'staying shut in' continuously.

text: 嫌っていうわけでもないのよ それが問題なのよね
translation: It's not that he hates it exactly. That's the problem, isn't it.
grammar: わけでもない means 'it's not that...' - used to partially deny something while acknowledging complexity.

text: 帰れ
translation: Go home!
grammar: Imperative form of 帰る - a direct, harsh command.

text: よくやったなシンジ
translation: You did well, Shinji.
grammar: よくやった is a common praise phrase meaning 'well done' or 'good job.'

text: シンジ君
translation: Shinji-kun.
grammar: 君 is an honorific suffix typically used for boys or younger males, showing familiarity.

text: 開けるわよ
translation: I'm opening the door.
grammar: わよ is a feminine sentence-ending particle combination expressing assertion or announcement.

text: 怖いの? / お父さんと二人で会うのが
translation: Are you scared? / Of meeting your father, just the two of you?
grammar: のが nominalizes the preceding clause, making the entire phrase the subject of 怖い.

text: 逃げてばかりじゃダメよ / 自分から一歩を踏み出さないと / 何も変わらないわ / 分かってるよ
translation: You can't just keep running away. / If you don't take the first step yourself... / Nothing will change. / I know.

vocabulary.meaning: to step forward, to take a step

grammar: てばかり means 'always doing' or 'nothing but doing,' often with negative connotation.

text: これから分かるのよ / 最初の一歩だけじゃなく
translation: You'll come to understand from now on. / It's not just about the first step.
grammar: だけじゃなく means 'not only... but also,' indicating there's more to consider beyond the first point.

text: その後に続けることも大切だってことが / とにかく / 明日は胸を張っていきなさい / お母さんにも会うんだから / じゃあおやすみ
translation: That continuing afterwards is also important. Anyway, hold your head high tomorrow. You're going to see your mother too. Well, goodnight.

vocabulary.meaning: to hold one's head high, be proud

grammar: ~ことが大切 (koto ga taisetsu) - nominalizing with koto to say 'doing X is important'

text: ねえ / 明日の服買ったんでしょ / 見せてよ / ていたかったんだからだよってんよっ / 知りだから
translation: Hey, you bought clothes for tomorrow, right? Show me! I wanted to see them! Just a little peek.
grammar: ~んでしょ - casual confirmation seeking, expecting agreement

text: カジさんの趣味に合わせます / それはないっしょ
translation: I'm matching Kaji-san's taste. No way, that can't be right!
grammar: ~に合わせる - to match/adjust to something/someone

text: じゃあいってきます
translation: Well then, I'm off!
grammar: 行ってきます - set phrase said when leaving home, implying you will return

text: 3つのふくらというものを心にん / ではしばし五感談のほど
translation: Please keep three blessings in your heart. Now then, please enjoy this moment of relaxation.
grammar: ~のほど - formal/polite way to request or wish for something

text: 来ないわねリョウちゃん / あのバカが時間通りに来たことなんて一変もないわよ
translation: Ryoji isn't coming, is he? That idiot has never once come on time.
grammar: ~たことがない - have never done something (negative experience)

text: デートの時はでしょ仕事は違ってたわよ / いやお二人とも今日は一段と美しい
translation: That's for dates, right? Work was different. My, you both look especially beautiful today.
grammar: 一段と + adjective - emphasizes degree, 'even more/especially'

text: 時間までに仕事抜けられなくてさ / いつもプラプラ暇そうにしてるくせに
translation: I couldn't get away from work in time. Even though you're always wandering around looking free.
grammar: ~くせに - 'even though, despite' with critical/negative nuance

text: どうでもいいけどなんとかならないのその武将ひげ / ほらネクタイも貼ってる
translation: Whatever, but can't you do something about that stubble? Look, your tie is crooked too.
grammar: なんとかならない - rhetorical 'can't something be done about this?'

text: これはどうも / 夫婦みたいよあなたたち / いいこと言うねえリッちゃん / 誰がこんな奴と
translation: Well, thank you. You two are like a married couple. Good point, Ritchan! Who would ever be with someone like him?
grammar: ~みたい - 'looks like, seems like, similar to'

text: 3年ぶりだな / 2人でここに来るのは
translation: It's been three years, hasn't it? Since the two of us came here together.

vocabulary.meaning: for the first time in X years

grammar: ~ぶり - expresses doing something for the first time in a period

text: 僕はあの時逃げ出して / その後は来てない / ここに母さんが眠ってるってピンとこないんだ / 顔も覚えてないのに
translation: I ran away back then. Haven't been here since. It doesn't feel real that mother is resting here. I don't even remember her face.
grammar: ピンとこない - idiomatic expression meaning something doesn't register or feel real

text: 人は思い出を忘れることで生きていける
translation: People can go on living by forgetting memories.
grammar: ~ことで - 'by doing X' - expresses means or method

text: だが決して忘れてはならないこともある / ユイはそのかけがえのないものを教えてくれた
translation: But there are also things that must never be forgotten. Yui taught me those irreplaceable things.
grammar: ~てはならない - must not do, expressing strong prohibition

text: 私はその確認をするためにここへ来ている
translation: I come here to confirm that.
grammar: ~ために - expresses purpose, 'in order to'

text: 写真とかないの? / 残ってはいない / この墓もただの飾りだ / 遺体はない / 先生の言ってた通り / 全部捨てちゃったんだね / 全ては心の中だ
translation: Don't you have any photos or anything? None remain. This grave is just a decoration. There's no body. Just like sensei said, you threw everything away. Everything is in the heart.
grammar: ~通り - 'just as, exactly like' someone said/did

text: 今はそれでいい
translation: For now, that's fine.
grammar: それでいい - set phrase meaning 'that's acceptable/fine'

text: 時間だ / 先に帰るぞ
translation: It's time. I'm heading back first.
grammar: ~ぞ - masculine sentence-ending particle adding assertion/determination

text: 父さん
translation: Father.
grammar: Simple address form for one's father

text: あの / 今日は嬉しかった / 父さんと話せて
translation: Um... I was happy today. Being able to talk with you, father.
grammar: ~て form at end - expresses reason/cause for preceding statement

text: そうか
translation: I see.
grammar: そうか - minimal acknowledgment, characteristic of reserved speakers

text: 結構いけるじゃない / そんなの持ってたの / 5歳の時から始めてこの程度だからね / 才能なんて別にないよ / 継続は力か / 少し見直しちゃった
translation: You're pretty good! You had something like that? I started at age 5 and this is all I can do. I don't have any special talent. Persistence is power, huh? I've gained a bit more respect for you.
grammar: 継続は力なり - famous proverb meaning 'persistence is power'

text: 先生に言われて始めたことだし / すぐ辞めてもよかったんだ / じゃあなんで続けてたのよ / 誰も / やめろって言 / わなかったから / やっぱりね
translation: I started because my teacher told me to. I could have quit right away. Then why did you keep going? Because no one told me to stop. Figures.
grammar: ~てもよかった - 'it would have been fine to do X'

text: 早かったんだね / 夕飯食べてくるんだと思った / 退屈なんだもんあの子 / だからさジェットコースター待ってる間に帰ってきちゃった / それはないと思うな
translation: You're back early. I thought you'd eat dinner out. That guy was so boring. So I came back while waiting in line for the roller coaster. I don't think that's fair.
grammar: ~ちゃった - casual contraction of ~てしまった, often implies regret or completion

text: はぁまともな男はカジさんだけね
translation: Sigh... Kaji-san is the only decent guy.
grammar: ~だけ - 'only X' limiting particle

text: 今さら何言ってんだか / ちょっちお手洗い / とか言って逃げんなよ
translation: What are you saying at this point? I need to use the restroom for a sec. Don't try to escape by saying that.

vocabulary.meaning: at this point, now of all times

grammar: ~んなよ - rough masculine prohibition, contraction of ~るなよ

text: ヒールか / 何年ぶりかな? / 3人で飲むなんて / ミサト飲みすぎじゃない? / なんだかはしゃいでるけど
translation: Heels, huh? How many years has it been? The three of us drinking together. Isn't Misato drinking too much? She seems kind of excited.
grammar: ~すぎ - suffix meaning 'too much' attached to verb stems

text: 浮かれる自分を抑えようとして / また飲んでる / 今日は逆か?
translation: She's drinking again trying to suppress her excitement. Is it the opposite today?

vocabulary.meaning: to be excited, to be in high spirits

grammar: The te-form + いる (飲んでる) indicates ongoing or habitual action.

text: やっぱり一緒に暮らしてた人の言葉は / 重みが違うわね
translation: As expected, the words of someone you lived with carry different weight.
grammar: The past progressive 暮らしてた (contracted from 暮らしていた) describes past continuous state.

text: 暮らしてたって言っても / かすらぎがヒールとか履く前のことだからな
translation: Even if you say we lived together, that was before Katsuragi even wore heels.
grammar: って言っても is a colloquial way of saying 'even if you say that' or 'although you say'.

text: 学生時代には想像できなかったわよね / 俺もガキだったし
translation: We couldn't have imagined this back in our student days. I was just a kid too.
grammar: できなかった is the negative past of できる (potential form), meaning 'couldn't do'.

text: あれは暮らしっていうより共同生活だな / ママごとだ / 現実は甘くないさ / そうだこれ猫の土産 / あらありがとう / 豆ね
translation: That was more like communal living than actually living together. Playing house. Reality isn't sweet. Oh right, here's a souvenir for the cat. Oh thank you. Beans, huh.
grammar: っていうより means 'rather than' or 'more than', used to correct or clarify.

text: 女性にはね仕事はズボラさ / どうだか / ミサトには / 一度敗戦してる / 負ける戦はしない主義だ / 称賛はあると思うけど / りっちゃんは?
translation: I'm sloppy when it comes to women. Sure... With Misato, I already lost once. My policy is not to fight battles I'll lose. I think there's a chance though. What about you, Ritsuko?

vocabulary.meaning: praise; here likely 勝算 (chance of winning)

grammar: 負ける戦はしない - using a negative verb with は to express 'don't do X' as a policy.

text: 自分の話はしない主義なの / 面白くないもの / 遅いな、葛城 / 化粧でも直してんのか?
translation: I have a policy of not talking about myself. It's not interesting. Katsuragi's taking a while. Is she fixing her makeup or something?
grammar: でも adds a sense of 'or something like that' when used with verbs.

text: 京都、何しに行ってきたの? / あれ?松城だよ、その土産 / とぼけても無駄 / あまり深追いするとやけどするわよ
translation: What did you go to Kyoto for? Huh? This souvenir is from Matsushiro. Playing dumb won't work. If you dig too deep, you'll get burned.

vocabulary.meaning: to play dumb, to feign ignorance

grammar: 何しに is a colloquial way to ask 'what for' or 'for what purpose'.

text: これは友人としての忠告 / 真摯に聞いとくよ / どうせやけどするなら / 君との冷や / すべ / 花火でも買ってきましょうか? / おかえり / 変わんないわね、そのおかるいとこ
translation: This is advice from a friend. I'll take it seriously. If I'm going to get burned anyway, I'd rather it be with you— Shall I go buy some fireworks? Welcome back. You haven't changed, still so flippant.
grammar: としての means 'as a' (in the capacity of), here 'as a friend'.

text: 変わってるさ / 生きるってことは変わるってことさ
translation: I have changed. Living means changing.
grammar: ってことは is a casual way to say 'means that' or 'the thing is'.

text: オメオスタシスとトランジスタシスね / 何それ? / 今を維持しようとする力と変えようとする力 / その矛盾する二つの性質を一緒に共有してるのが生き物なのよ / 男と女だな
translation: Homeostasis and transistasis. What's that? The force trying to maintain the present and the force trying to change it. Living things share these two contradictory qualities together. Like men and women.
grammar: しようとする means 'trying to do' - volitional form + とする.

text: そろそろ置い飛ばせるわ / 仕事も残ってるし / そう? / 残念だな / じゃあね
translation: I should get going soon. I still have work left. Really? That's too bad. See you.
grammar: し at the end adds a reason in a soft way, like 'since' or 'and also'.

text: あ、しんちゃん、あたし、今はカジ君と飲んでんの / そう、三次会でね / はい、 / はい、じゃあ / みさと?
translation: Oh, Shin-chan, I'm drinking with Kaji right now. Yeah, it's the third after-party. Okay... okay, bye then. Misato?
grammar: 飲んでんの is a casual contraction of 飲んでいるの, common in spoken Japanese.

text: うん、遅くなるから先に寝ててって / え、朝帰りってことじゃないでしょうね
translation: She said she'll be late so go to bed first. Wait, that doesn't mean she's staying out all night, right?

vocabulary.meaning: coming home in the morning (after staying out all night)

grammar: ってこと is a casual way to say 'that means' or 'the thing about'.

text: まさか、カジさんも一緒なのに / あんたバカ?だからでしょ
translation: No way, Kaji is with her after all. Are you stupid? That's exactly why!
grammar: なのに means 'even though' or 'despite that'.

text: いい歳して戻すなよ / 悪かったわねいい歳で / 歳はお互い様か / そうよ
translation: Don't throw up at your age. Sorry for being 'at my age.' We're the same age, you know. That's right.

vocabulary.meaning: at one's age (implying too old for something)
we're in the same boat, mutual

grammar: いい歳して is an expression meaning 'at your age' with a critical nuance.

text: カツラギがヒール履いてんだからな / 時の流れを感じるよ
translation: Katsuragi is wearing heels now. I really feel the passage of time.
grammar: んだから is emphatic, stressing the reason or fact.

text: 武将姫そんな際よ / へ / えへ / あとはルックありがとう
translation: That stubble is awful. Heh... hehe... Anyway, thanks for looking after me.

vocabulary.meaning: occasion (here seems to be audio unclear)

grammar: Audio appears unclear in parts of this segment.

text: 自分が男に父親の姿を求めてたって、それに気づいた時、怖かった。どうしようもなく怖かった。
translation: When I realized that I was seeking a father figure in men... I was scared. Hopelessly scared.
grammar: てた is a casual contraction of ていた (past progressive).

text: カジ君と一緒にいることも、自分が女だということも、何もかもが怖かったわ。
translation: Being with Kaji, being a woman... everything scared me.
grammar: ということ nominalizes the preceding clause, turning it into a noun phrase.

text: 父を憎んでいた私が、父によく似た人を好きになる。
translation: I, who hated my father, fell in love with someone who resembled him.

vocabulary.meaning: to come to like, to fall in love

grammar: によく似た is 'closely resembles' - に marks what is resembled, よく intensifies.

text: すべてをふっきりつもりでネルホを選んだけれど
translation: I chose NERV intending to put everything behind me, but...

vocabulary.meaning: to get over, to put behind oneself

grammar: つもりで indicates doing something with the intention of.

text: でもそれも父のいた組織 / 結局使徒に復讐することでみんなごまかしてきたんだわ
translation: But that was also the organization my father was in. In the end, I've been deceiving everyone by taking revenge on the Angels.
grammar: ことで means 'by doing' - nominalizing an action as a means.

text: カツラギが自分で選んだことだ / 俺に謝ることはないよ
translation: That was your own choice, Katsuragi. You don't need to apologize to me.
grammar: ことはない means 'there's no need to' or 'don't have to'.

text: 違うのよ選んだわけじゃないの / ただ逃げてただけ
translation: No, it's not that I chose it. I was just running away.

vocabulary.meaning: to be different, to be wrong

grammar: わけじゃない means 'it's not that...' or 'it doesn't mean that...'.

text: 父親という地幕から逃げ出しただけ / シンジ君と同じだわ / 臆病者なのよ
translation: I just ran away from the curse of having a father. Just like Shinji. I'm a coward.
grammar: という connects a noun with its description or name.

text: ごめんね本当 / 先の勢いで今さらこんな話 / もういい / 子供なのね
translation: I'm really sorry. Getting carried away and bringing up something like this now. That's enough. I'm just a child, aren't I.

vocabulary.meaning: at this point, now (when it's too late)

grammar: 今さら implies doing something when it's too late or no longer appropriate.

text: シンジ君に何も言う資格ない / もういい / その上こうやって / 都合のいい時だけ男にすがろうとする / ずるい女なのよ / あの時だってカジ君を利用してただけかもしれない / やんなるわ
translation: I have no right to say anything to Shinji. Enough already. On top of that, I try to cling to men only when it's convenient. I'm such a cunning woman. Back then, I might have just been using Kaji. I'm disgusted with myself.

vocabulary.meaning: to cling to, to depend on
to use, to make use of

grammar: すがろうとする uses volitional form + とする to express 'trying to do something'

text: もういいやめろ / 自分に絶望するわよ / ああああああ
translation: That's enough, stop it. I'll end up despairing of myself. Ahhhh.

vocabulary.meaning: stop it (imperative form of やめる)

grammar: 絶望する - the verb form of the noun 絶望, meaning 'to despair' or 'to lose hope'

text: ねえシンジー キスしようか / ん? 何? / キスよ、キス。したことないでしょ? / うん。 / じゃあ、しよう。 / どうして? / 退屈だからよ。
translation: Hey Shinji, shall we kiss? Hm? What? A kiss, a kiss. You've never done it, have you? Yeah. Then let's do it. Why? Because I'm bored.
grammar: しようか is volitional form + か, used to suggest or propose doing something together

text: 退屈だからって、そんな。 / お母さんの命日に女の子とキスするの嫌?
translation: Just because you're bored, that's... Do you hate kissing a girl on your mother's death anniversary?
grammar: だからって is a casual contraction of だからといって, meaning 'just because'

text: 天国から見てるかもしれないからって。 / 別に。 / それとも怖い? / 怖くないよ、キスくらい。 / はっ、磨いてるわよね。 / うん。 / じゃあ、行くわよ。
translation: Because she might be watching from heaven, you mean? Not really. Or are you scared? I'm not scared of something like a kiss. Ha, you do brush your teeth, right? Yeah. Okay, here I go.
grammar: くらい after a noun minimizes its importance - 'something as trivial as a kiss'

text: 鼻息がこそばゆいから息しないで
translation: Your breath through your nose is ticklish, so don't breathe.
grammar: しないで is the negative te-form, used here as a soft command meaning 'don't do'

text: あっ?
translation: Huh?
grammar: Simple interjection expressing surprise or realization

text: うえぇ、やっぱ暇つぶしにやるもんじゃないわ
translation: Ugh, kissing really isn't something you should do just to kill time.
grammar: もんじゃない is casual form of ものではない, expressing 'should not do' or 'not something one does'

text: ほら、着いたぞ、しっかりしろ
translation: Hey, we've arrived. Pull yourself together.

vocabulary.meaning: to pull oneself together, to be firm

grammar: しろ is the imperative form of する, giving a direct command

text: カジさん
translation: Kaji-san...
grammar: Simple address using the polite suffix さん

text: カジさん
translation: Kaji-san...
grammar: Repeated address showing emotional attachment or neediness

text: じゃあ、俺は帰るから / カジさんも泊まっていけば?
translation: Well, I'm heading home. / Why don't you stay over too, Kaji-san?
grammar: ていけば is te-form + いく in conditional form, suggesting 'why don't you (do and go/continue)'

text: この格好で出勤したら笑われちゃうよ / ええ?大丈夫よ。ねええ。カジさんてば。 / またな。
translation: If I went to work dressed like this, I'd be laughed at. / Huh? It's fine. Hey. Kaji-san, come on. / See you.
grammar: てば is a casual suffix used to get someone's attention or express mild frustration

text: ラベンダーの香りがする。 / すまないが、二人ともカツラギのこと頼んだぞ。 / はい。 / じゃあ、おやすみ。 / おやすみなさい。
translation: There's a lavender scent. / Sorry, but I'm counting on you two to take care of Katsuragi. / Yes. / Well, goodnight. / Goodnight.
grammar: 頼んだぞ uses past tense + ぞ for emphatic request - 'I'm counting on you'

text: どうしたの?元きないね。 / あんたなんかとキスしたからよ!
translation: What's wrong? You seem down. / It's because I kissed someone like you!
grammar: なんか after a person is dismissive/derogatory - 'someone like you' (in a negative way)

text: では続いて女子綾波
translation: Next, for the girls, Ayanami.
grammar: 続いて is the te-form of 続く used adverbially to mean 'following' or 'next'

text: 綾波は今日も休みか / Пс-с-с.
translation: Ayanami is absent again today, huh. / Psst.
grammar: か at the end of a statement indicates rhetorical confirmation or mild surprise

text: 2日酔いの調子はどうだ? / おかげでやっと冷めたわ / そりゃよかった / これがあなたの本当の仕事? / それともアルバイトかしら? / どっちかな?
translation: How's the hangover? / Thanks to that, I've finally sobered up. / That's good. / Is this your real job? Or is it a side job? / Which one, I wonder?

vocabulary.meaning: to cool down, to sober up

grammar: おかげで expresses 'thanks to' something, often used both sincerely and sarcastically

text: 特務機関NERV特殊監査部所属カジ領事 / 同時に日本政府内務省調査部所属カジ領事でもあるわけね / バレバレか? / ネルフは甘く見ないで
translation: Kaji Ryoji, belonging to NERV Special Agency's Special Inspection Division. At the same time, you're also Kaji Ryoji belonging to the Japanese Government's Ministry of Internal Affairs Investigation Division, right? / Was it that obvious? / Don't underestimate NERV.
grammar: わけね uses わけ (reason/explanation) + ね for confirmation - 'so that's how it is, right?'

text: イカリ司令の命令か? / 私の独断よ / これ以上バイトを続けると / 死ぬわ
translation: Is this Commander Ikari's order? / It's my own decision. / If you continue this side job any further, you'll die.
grammar: これ以上...と means 'if (you do) any more than this' - expressing a warning about consequences

text: イカリ司令は俺を利用してる / まだ行けるさ
translation: Commander Ikari is using me. / I can still keep going.

vocabulary.meaning: to use, to make use of

grammar: さ at the end adds casual assertion or reassurance to the statement

text: だけどカツラゲに隠し事をしてたのは謝るよ / 昨日のお礼にチャラにするわ / それはどう思う / ただ
translation: But I do apologize for keeping secrets from you, Katsuragi. / I'll call it even as thanks for last night. / What do you think about that? / However...
grammar: チャラにする means 'to call it even' or 'to cancel out' - colloquial expression

text: 司令やリッチャンも君に隠し事をしてる / それがこれさ
translation: The Commander and Ritsuko are also keeping secrets from you. / This is what it is.
grammar: や is used to list items non-exhaustively, implying there may be others

text: これは…
translation: This is...
grammar: Trailing off with は... indicates shock or inability to complete the thought

text: エヴァ… / いえ… / マサク… / そう…セカンドインパクトからそのすべての要であり / 始まりでもある
translation: Eva... / No... / Could it be... / Yes... The keystone of everything since Second Impact, and also the beginning.
grammar: であり...でもある uses formal copula forms to link two descriptions of the same thing

text: アダムだ / アダム…あの第一使徒がここに… / 確かに ネルフは私が考えているほど甘くないわね
translation: It's Adam. / Adam... The First Angel is here... / Indeed, NERV isn't as naive as I thought.
grammar: ほど甘くない - 'not as ~ as' structure using ほど for comparison

text: ご / 視聴ありがとうございました
translation: Thank you for watching.

vocabulary.word: ありがとうございました
vocabulary.reading: ありがとうございました

grammar: ございました is the polite past form, used in formal expressions of gratitude
